description: Hummingbird's mint (Agastache cana) is an amazing native species that brings a unique beauty to the garden. It has intensely fragrant pink-purple flower spikes that will entice hummingbirds and butterflies from all around. On top of that, hummingbird's mint has an unbeatable drought-tolerance, making it low-maintenance and a great choice for gardeners in areas with hot, dry summers. In cooler climates, the plant will die back in winter but will come back to life again in late spring. Enjoy beautiful, aromatic blooms throughout the summer and into fall!
